definition: to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: He had been arguing with the police,and was angry with them.
sentences.chinese: 他一直与警方争讼着，而且对警方十分气愤。

sentences.english: and do not show favoritism to a poor man in his lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 也不可在争讼的事上偏护穷人。

sentences.english: How to settle the IPR disputes incurred by technical barriers?
sentences.chinese: 应当如何解决因技术壁垒所引发的知识产权争讼？

sentences.english: Do not deny justice to your poor people in their lawsuits.
sentences.chinese: 不可在穷人争讼的事上屈枉正直。

definition: to hear litigation (in a law court)/to hear a case
fateful accident/inauspicious matter (involving death or casualties)
a hard legal case to judge
to confront sb with accusation/written charge in court (in former times)/to take sb to court
to remove perils and solve disputes (idiom); to reconcile differences
to secure a position/to take an official appointment
